##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerp"></a>1.1.1.2.1.9. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.p`

**Title:** p

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.1.2.1.10. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerq"></a>1.1.1.2.1.11. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.q`

**Title:** q

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** Reactive power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.1.2.1.12. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.1.2.1.13. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumercustomerCount"></a>1.1.1.2.1.14. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.customerCount`

**Title:** customerCount

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `integer` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Number of individual customers represented by this demand.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumergrounded"></a>1.1.1.2.1.15. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.grounded`

**Title:** grounded

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Used for Yn and Zn connections. True if the neutral is solidly grounded.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerpfixed"></a>1.1.1.2.1.16. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.pfixed`

**Title:** pfixed

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power of the load that is a fixed quantity and does not vary as load group value varies. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerpfixedPct"></a>1.1.1.2.1.17. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > ConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.pfixedPct`

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |

**Description:** Fixed active power as a percentage of load group fixed active power. Used to represent the time-varying components.  Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.

| - [EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic ) | No      | object           | No         | Same as [EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic )                                                                               | Models the characteristic response of the load demand due to changes in system conditions such as voltage and frequency. It is not related to demand response.<br />If LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is True, the exponential voltage or frequency dependent models are specified and used as to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model.<br />The equations to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model are internal to the power flow calculation, hence they use different quantities depending on the use case of the data exchange. <br />The equations for exponential voltage dependent load model injected power are: <br />pInjection= Pnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.pVoltageExponent<br />qInjection= Qnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.qVoltageExponent<br />Where: <br />1) * means "multiply" and ** is "raised to power of";<br />2) Pnominal and Qnominal represent the active power and reactive power at nominal voltage as any load described by the voltage exponential model shall be given at nominal voltage.  This means that EnergyConsumer.p and EnergyConsumer.q  are at nominal voltage.<br />3) After power flow is solved: <br />-pInjection and qInjection correspond to SvPowerflow.p and SvPowerflow.q respectively.  <br />- Voltage corresponds to SvVoltage.v at the TopologicalNode where the load is connected. |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumerEnergyConsumerAction"></a>1.1.1.2.2.4. ##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic"></a>1.1.1.2.2.5. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic`

|                           |                                                                                                                                                               |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**              | No                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.")                                                                                     |
| **Same definition as**    | [EnergyConsumer.LoadResponseCharacteristic](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i0_EnergyConsumerLoadResponseCharacteristic) |

**Description:** Models the characteristic response of the load demand due to changes in system conditions such as voltage and frequency. It is not related to demand response.
If LoadResponseCharacteristic.exponentModel is True, the exponential voltage or frequency dependent models are specified and used as to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model.
The equations to calculate active and reactive power components of the load model are internal to the power flow calculation, hence they use different quantities depending on the use case of the data exchange. 
The equations for exponential voltage dependent load model injected power are: 
pInjection= Pnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.pVoltageExponent
qInjection= Qnominal* (Voltage/cim:BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage) ** cim:LoadResponseCharacteristic.qVoltageExponent
Where: 
1) * means "multiply" and ** is "raised to power of";
2) Pnominal and Qnominal represent the active power and reactive power at nominal voltage as any load described by the voltage exponential model shall be given at nominal voltage.  This means that EnergyConsumer.p and EnergyConsumer.q  are at nominal voltage.
3) After power flow is solved: 
-pInjection and qInjection correspond to SvPowerflow.p and SvPowerflow.q respectively.  
- Voltage corresponds to SvVoltage.v at the TopologicalNode where the load is connected.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage"></a>1.1.1.2.2.6. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage`

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumerp"></a>1.1.1.2.2.9. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.p`

**Title:** p

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.1.2.2.10. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EnergyConsumerq"></a>1.1.1.2.2.11. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > EnergyConsumer.q`

**Title:** q

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** Reactive power of the load. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
For voltage dependent loads the value is at rated voltage.
Starting value for a steady state solution.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.1.2.2.12. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.1.2.2.13. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.1.2.2.22. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > IdentifiedObject.description`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.1.2.2.23. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.1.2.2.24. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergyConsumer_oneOf_i1_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.1.2.2.25. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergyConsumer > oneOf > NonConformLoad > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource"></a>1.1.1.3. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| **Required**              | No                                                                        |

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourceEnergySourcePhase_items_EnergySourcePhasephase"></a>1.1.1.3.7.1.1. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase.phase`

**Title:** phase

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `enum (of string)`                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.phase](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhasephase) |

**Description:** Phase of this energy source component.   If the energy source wye connected, the connection is from the indicated phase to the central ground or neutral point.  If the energy source is delta connected, the phase indicates an energy source connected from the indicated phase to the next logical non-neutral phase.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourceEnergySourcePhase_items_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.1.3.7.1.2. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourceEnergySourcePhase_items_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.1.3.7.1.3. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourceEnergySourcePhase_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.1.3.7.1.4. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourceEnergySourcePhase_items_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.1.3.7.1.5. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.EnergySourcePhase > EnergySourcePhase > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourcepMin"></a>1.1.1.3.9. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.pMin`

**Title:** pMin

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** This is the minimum active power that can be produced by the source. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a TopologicalNode (bus) into the conducting equipment.

**Description:** This is the maximum active power that can be produced by the source. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a TopologicalNode (bus) into the conducting equipment.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourcereactivePower"></a>1.1.1.3.12. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.reactivePower`

**Title:** reactivePower

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** High voltage source reactive injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.1.3.13. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.1.3.14. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.1.3.15. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EquipmentinService"></a>1.1.1.3.16. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourceactivePower"></a>1.1.1.3.17. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.activePower`

**Description:** High voltage source active injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourcern"></a>1.1.1.3.21. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.rn`

**Title:** rn

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourcevoltageAngle"></a>1.1.1.3.22. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > EnergySource.voltageAngle`

**Title:** voltageAngle

|                |                     |
| -------------- | ------------------- |
| **Type**       | `object or number`  |
| **Required**   | No                  |
| **Defined in** | ./AngleRadians.json |

**Description:** Phase angle of a-phase open circuit used when voltage characteristics need to be imposed at the node associated with the terminal of the energy source, such as when voltages and angles from the transmission level are used as input to the distribution network. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero.

| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------- |
| - [multiplier](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_EnergySourcevoltageAngle_multiplier ) | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [multiplier](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_multiplier ) | nan               |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.1.3.27. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.1.3.28. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_EnergySource_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.1.3.29. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EnergyConnection > EnergySource > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

#### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter"></a>1.1.2. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./ACDCConverter.json                                                      |

**Description:** A unit with valves for three phases, together with unit control equipment, essential protective and switching devices, DC storage capacitors, phase reactors and auxiliaries, if any, used for conversion.

| Property                                                                   | Pattern | Type   | Deprecated | Definition            | Title/Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ------ | ---------- | --------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| - [VsConverter](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter ) | No      | object | No         | In ./VsConverter.json | DC side of the voltage source converter (VSC).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| - [CsConverter](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter ) | No      | object | No         | In ./CsConverter.json | DC side of the current source converter (CSC).<br />The firing angle controls the dc voltage at the converter, both for rectifier and inverter. The difference between the dc voltages of the rectifier and inverter determines the dc current. The extinction angle is used to limit the dc voltage at the inverter, if needed, and is not used in active power control. The firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filters are the primary means to control a current source dc line. Higher level controls are built on top, e.g. dc voltage, dc current and active power. From a steady state perspective it is sufficient to specify the wanted active power transfer (ACDCConverter.targetPpcc) and the control functions will set the dc voltage, dc current, firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filters to meet this. Therefore attributes targetAlpha and targetGamma are not applicable in this case.<br />The reactive power consumed by the converter is a function of the firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filter, which can be approximated with half of the active power. The losses is a function of the dc voltage and dc current.<br />The attributes minAlpha and maxAlpha define the range of firing angles for rectifier operation between which no discrete tap changer action takes place. The range is typically 10-18 degrees.<br />The attributes minGamma and maxGamma define the range of extinction angles for inverter operation between which no discrete tap changer action takes place. The range is typically 17-20 degrees. |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_PowerSystemResourceLocation"></a>1.1.2.1.1. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > PowerSystemResource.Location`

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_PowerSystemResourceGenericAction"></a>1.1.2.1.2. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > PowerSystemResource.GenericAction`

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ConductingEquipmentTerminals"></a>1.1.2.1.3. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ConductingEquipment.Terminals`

**Title:** Terminal

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

**Description:** An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

|                      | Array restrictions |
| -------------------- | ------------------ |
| **Min items**        | N/A                |
| **Max items**        | N/A                |
| **Items unicity**    | False              |
| **Additional items** | False              |
| **Tuple validation** | See below          |

| Each item of this array must be                                                                              | Description                                                                                                                                            |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [Terminal.json](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items) | An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes. |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterp"></a>1.1.2.1.7. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ACDCConverter.p`

**Description:** Active power at the point of common coupling. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution in the case a simplified power flow model is used.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterminP"></a>1.1.2.1.10. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ACDCConverter.minP`

| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Minimum active power limit. The value is overwritten by values of VsCapabilityCurve, if present.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.2.1.11. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.2.1.12. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterratedUdc"></a>1.1.2.1.13. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ACDCConverter.ratedUdc`

**Title:** ratedUdc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** Rated converter DC voltage, also called UdN. The attribute shall be a positive value. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. For instance a bipolar HVDC link with value  200 kV has a 400kV difference between the dc lines.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.2.1.14. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterpPccControl"></a>1.1.2.1.15. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > VsConverter.pPccControl`

**Title:** pPccControl

|                |                          |
| -------------- | ------------------------ |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`       |
| **Required**   | No                       |
| **Defined in** | ./VsPpccControlKind.json |

**Description:** Kind of control of real power and/or DC voltage.

Must be one of:
* "pPcc"
* "udc"
* "pPccAndUdcDroop"
* "pPccAndUdcDroopWithCompensation"
* "pPccAndUdcDroopPilot"
* "phasePcc"

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConvertermaxModulationIndex"></a>1.1.2.1.26. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > VsConverter.maxModulationIndex`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The maximum quotient between the AC converter voltage (Uc) and DC voltage (Ud). A factor typically less than 1. It is converters configuration data used in power flow.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterqPccControl"></a>1.1.2.1.27. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > VsConverter.qPccControl`

| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power loss in pole at no power transfer. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterpoleLossP"></a>1.1.2.1.38. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ACDCConverter.poleLossP`

**Title:** poleLossP

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The active power loss at a DC Pole 
= idleLoss + switchingLoss*|Idc| + resitiveLoss*Idc^2.
For lossless operation Pdc=Pac.
For rectifier operation with losses Pdc=Pac-lossP.
For inverter operation with losses Pdc=Pac+lossP.
It is converters state variable used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_ACDCConverterresistiveLoss"></a>1.1.2.1.39. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > ACDCConverter.resistiveLoss`

**Description:** It is converters configuration data used in power flow. Refer to poleLossP. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.2.1.44. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.2.1.45. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.2.1.46. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > VsConverter > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter"></a>1.1.2.2. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./CsConverter.json                                                        |

**Description:** DC side of the current source converter (CSC).
The firing angle controls the dc voltage at the converter, both for rectifier and inverter. The difference between the dc voltages of the rectifier and inverter determines the dc current. The extinction angle is used to limit the dc voltage at the inverter, if needed, and is not used in active power control. The firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filters are the primary means to control a current source dc line. Higher level controls are built on top, e.g. dc voltage, dc current and active power. From a steady state perspective it is sufficient to specify the wanted active power transfer (ACDCConverter.targetPpcc) and the control functions will set the dc voltage, dc current, firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filters to meet this. Therefore attributes targetAlpha and targetGamma are not applicable in this case.
The reactive power consumed by the converter is a function of the firing angle, transformer tap position and number of connected filter, which can be approximated with half of the active power. The losses is a function of the dc voltage and dc current.
The attributes minAlpha and maxAlpha define the range of firing angles for rectifier operation between which no discrete tap changer action takes place. The range is typically 10-18 degrees.
The attributes minGamma and maxGamma define the range of extinction angles for inverter operation between which no discrete tap changer action takes place. The range is typically 17-20 degrees.

| Property                                                                                                                          | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | Title/Description      |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ConductingEquipmentTerminals"></a>1.1.2.2.3. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ConductingEquipment.Terminals`

**Title:** Terminal

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

**Description:** An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

|                      | Array restrictions |
| -------------------- | ------------------ |
| **Min items**        | N/A                |
| **Max items**        | N/A                |
| **Items unicity**    | False              |
| **Additional items** | False              |
| **Tuple validation** | See below          |

| Each item of this array must be                                                                              | Description                                                                                                                                            |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [Terminal.json](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items) | An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes. |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConverteralpha"></a>1.1.2.2.6. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.alpha`

**Title:** alpha

|                        |                                                                                                |
| ---------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                             |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                             |
| **Same definition as** | [VsConverter.delta](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta) |

**Description:** Firing angle that determines the dc voltage at the converter dc terminal. Typical value between 10 degrees and 18 degrees for a rectifier. It is converters state variable, result from power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConvertergamma"></a>1.1.2.2.7. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.gamma`

**Title:** gamma

|                        |                                                                                                |
| ---------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                             |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                             |
| **Same definition as** | [VsConverter.delta](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta) |

**Description:** Extinction angle. It is used to limit the dc voltage at the inverter if needed. Typical value between 17 degrees and 20 degrees for an inverter. It is converters state variable, result from power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConvertermaxAlpha"></a>1.1.2.2.8. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.maxAlpha`

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConvertertargetAlpha"></a>1.1.2.2.12. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.targetAlpha`

**Title:** targetAlpha

|                        |                                                                                                |
| ---------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                             |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                             |
| **Same definition as** | [VsConverter.delta](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta) |

**Description:** Target firing angle. It is converters control variable used in power flow. It is only applicable for rectifier if continuous tap changer control is used. Allowed values are within the range minAlpha<=targetAlpha<=maxAlpha. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConvertertargetGamma"></a>1.1.2.2.13. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.targetGamma`

**Title:** targetGamma

|                        |                                                                                                |
| ---------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                             |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                             |
| **Same definition as** | [VsConverter.delta](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta) |

**Description:** Target extinction angle. It is converters control variable used in power flow. It is only applicable for inverter if continuous tap changer control is used. Allowed values are within the range minGamma<=targetGamma<=maxGamma. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConvertertargetIdc"></a>1.1.2.2.14. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.targetIdc`

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConverterminIdc"></a>1.1.2.2.15. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.minIdc`

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConverteroperatingMode"></a>1.1.2.2.16. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.operatingMode`

**Title:** operatingMode

|                |                            |
| -------------- | -------------------------- |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`         |
| **Required**   | No                         |
| **Defined in** | ./CsOperatingModeKind.json |

**Description:** Indicates whether the DC pole is operating as an inverter or as a rectifier. It is converters control variable used in power flow.

Must be one of:
* "inverter"
* "rectifier"

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterp"></a>1.1.2.2.17. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.p`

**Title:** p

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Active power at the point of common coupling. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution in the case a simplified power flow model is used.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterq"></a>1.1.2.2.18. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.q`

**Description:** Reactive power at the point of common coupling. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for a steady state solution in the case a simplified power flow model is used.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterminP"></a>1.1.2.2.20. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.minP`

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.2.2.21. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.2.2.22. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.2.2.23. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.2.2.24. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConvertervalveU0"></a>1.1.2.2.30. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.valveU0`

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                   |

| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** Valve threshold voltage, also called Uvalve. Forward voltage drop when the valve is conducting. Used in loss calculations, i.e. the switchLoss depend on numberOfValves * valveU0.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterminUdc"></a>1.1.2.2.36. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.minUdc`

**Title:** minUdc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |
