##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterpoleLossP"></a>1.1.2.2.37. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.poleLossP`

**Title:** poleLossP

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** The active power loss at a DC Pole 
= idleLoss + switchingLoss*|Idc| + resitiveLoss*Idc^2.
For lossless operation Pdc=Pac.
For rectifier operation with losses Pdc=Pac-lossP.
For inverter operation with losses Pdc=Pac+lossP.
It is converters state variable used in power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConverterratedIdc"></a>1.1.2.2.38. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.ratedIdc`

**Title:** ratedIdc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** Rated converter DC current, also called IdN. The attribute shall be a positive value. It is converters configuration data used in power flow.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterratedUdc"></a>1.1.2.2.39. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.ratedUdc`

**Title:** ratedUdc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** Rated converter DC voltage, also called UdN. The attribute shall be a positive value. It is converters configuration data used in power flow. For instance a bipolar HVDC link with value  200 kV has a 400kV difference between the dc lines.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterresistiveLoss"></a>1.1.2.2.40. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.resistiveLoss`

**Title:** resistiveLoss

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** It is converters configuration data used in power flow. Refer to poleLossP. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConvertermaxP"></a>1.1.2.2.41. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.maxP`

**Title:** maxP

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Maximum active power limit. The value is overwritten by values of VsCapabilityCurve, if present.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverteruc"></a>1.1.2.2.42. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.uc`

**Title:** uc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** Line-to-line converter voltage, the voltage at the AC side of the valve. It is converters state variable, result from power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_ACDCConverterudc"></a>1.1.2.2.43. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > ACDCConverter.udc`

**Title:** udc

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** Converter voltage at the DC side, also called Ud. It is converters state variable, result from power flow. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.2.2.44. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_CsConverterpPccControl"></a>1.1.2.2.45. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > CsConverter.pPccControl`

**Title:** pPccControl

|                |                          |
| -------------- | ------------------------ |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`       |
| **Required**   | No                       |
| **Defined in** | ./CsPpccControlKind.json |

**Description:** Kind of active power control.

Must be one of:
* "activePower"
* "dcVoltage"
* "dcCurrent"

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_CsConverter_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.2.2.46. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > ACDCConverter > CsConverter > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

#### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment"></a>1.1.3. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./EquivalentEquipment.json                                                |

**Description:** The class represents equivalent objects that are the result of a network reduction. The class is the base for equivalent objects of different types.

| Property                                                                                         | Pattern | Type   | Deprecated | Definition                    | Title/Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------- | ------ | ---------- | ----------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| - [EquivalentInjection](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection ) | No      | object | No         | In ./EquivalentInjection.json | This class represents equivalent injections (generation or load).  Voltage regulation is allowed only at the point of connection.                                                                                                            |
| - [EquivalentBranch](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch )       | No      | object | No         | In ./EquivalentBranch.json    | The class represents equivalent branches. In cases where a transformer phase shift is modelled and the EquivalentBranch is spanning the same nodes, the impedance quantities for the EquivalentBranch shall consider the needed phase shift. |
| - [EquivalentShunt](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt )         | No      | object | No         | In ./EquivalentShunt.json     | The class represents equivalent shunts.                                                                                                                                                                                                      |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionmaxQ"></a>1.1.3.1.7. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.maxQ`

**Title:** maxQ

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnectionPhase.q](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsConnectionPhase_items_PowerElectronicsConnectionPhaseq) |

**Description:** Maximum reactive power of the injection.  Used for modelling of infeed for load flow exchange. Not used for short circuit modelling.  If maxQ and minQ are not used ReactiveCapabilityCurve can be used.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionminP"></a>1.1.3.1.8. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.minP`

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionr"></a>1.1.3.1.10. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.r`

**Title:** r

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** Positive sequence resistance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionr0"></a>1.1.3.1.11. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.r0`

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** Zero sequence resistance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionr2"></a>1.1.3.1.12. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.r2`

**Title:** r2

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** Negative sequence resistance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionregulationCapability"></a>1.1.3.1.13. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.regulationCapability`

**Title:** regulationCapability

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies whether or not the EquivalentInjection has the capability to regulate the local voltage. If true the EquivalentInjection can regulate. If false the EquivalentInjection cannot regulate. ReactiveCapabilityCurve can only be associated with EquivalentInjection  if the flag is true.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionregulationStatus"></a>1.1.3.1.14. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.regulationStatus`

**Title:** regulationStatus

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the regulation status of the EquivalentInjection.  True is regulating.  False is not regulating.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionregulationTarget"></a>1.1.3.1.15. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.regulationTarget`

**Title:** regulationTarget

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** The target voltage for voltage regulation. The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionx"></a>1.1.3.1.16. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.x`

**Title:** x

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** Positive sequence reactance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionx0"></a>1.1.3.1.17. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.x0`

| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** Zero sequence reactance. Used to represent Extended-Ward (IEC 60909).
Usage : Extended-Ward is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionx2"></a>1.1.3.1.18. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.x2`

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.3.1.19. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > IdentifiedObject.description`

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionp"></a>1.1.3.1.20. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.p`

**Title:** p

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsUnit.maxP](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_PowerElectronicsUnitmaxP) |

**Description:** Equivalent active power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquivalentInjectionq"></a>1.1.3.1.21. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > EquivalentInjection.q`

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |

**Description:** Equivalent reactive power injection. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a node.
Starting value for steady state solutions.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.3.1.22. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.3.1.23. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.3.1.24. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_EquipmentinService"></a>1.1.3.1.25. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.3.1.26. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.3.1.27. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentInjection_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.3.1.28. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentInjection > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch"></a>1.1.3.2. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./EquivalentBranch.json                                                   |

**Description:** The class represents equivalent branches. In cases where a transformer phase shift is modelled and the EquivalentBranch is spanning the same nodes, the impedance quantities for the EquivalentBranch shall consider the needed phase shift.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquivalentBranchnegativeR12"></a>1.1.3.2.9. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > EquivalentBranch.negativeR12`

**Title:** negativeR12

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** Negative sequence series resistance from terminal sequence  1 to terminal sequence 2. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquivalentBranchnegativeR21"></a>1.1.3.2.10. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > EquivalentBranch.negativeR21`

| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** Negative sequence series resistance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquivalentBranchnegativeX12"></a>1.1.3.2.11. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > EquivalentBranch.negativeX12`

**Title:** negativeX12

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** Negative sequence series reactance from terminal sequence  1 to terminal sequence 2. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.
Usage : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquivalentBranchr21"></a>1.1.3.2.18. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > EquivalentBranch.r21`

**Title:** r21

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr) |

**Description:** Resistance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1 .Used for steady state power flow. This attribute is optional and represent unbalanced network such as off-nominal phase shifter. If only EquivalentBranch.r is given, then EquivalentBranch.r21 is assumed equal to EquivalentBranch.r.
Usage rule : EquivalentBranch is a result of network reduction prior to the data exchange.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquivalentBranchx21"></a>1.1.3.2.20. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > EquivalentBranch.x21`

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |

| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** Reactance from terminal sequence 2 to terminal sequence 1. Used for steady state power flow. This attribute is optional and represents an unbalanced network such as off-nominal phase shifter. If only EquivalentBranch.x is given, then EquivalentBranch.x21 is assumed equal to EquivalentBranch.x.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.3.2.25. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.3.2.26. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquivalentLinehardeningCost"></a>1.1.3.2.27. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > EquivalentLine.hardeningCost`

| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.3.2.28. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_EquipmentinService"></a>1.1.3.2.29. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.3.2.30. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.3.2.31. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentBranch_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.3.2.32. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentBranch > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. ##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_EquivalentShuntb"></a>1.1.3.3.9. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > EquivalentShunt.b`

**Title:** b

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_EquipmentinService"></a>1.1.3.3.11. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.3.3.12. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.3.3.13. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.3.3.14. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EquivalentEquipment_EquivalentShunt_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.3.3.15. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EquivalentEquipment > EquivalentShunt > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

#### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Connector"></a>1.1.4. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Connector`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./Connector.json                                                          |

**Description:** A conductor, or group of conductors, with negligible impedance, that serve to connect other conducting equipment within a single substation and are modelled with a single logical terminal.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Connector_BusbarSectionipMax"></a>1.1.4.6. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Connector > BusbarSection.ipMax`

**Title:** ipMax

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** Maximum allowable peak short-circuit current of busbar (Ipmax in IEC 60909-0). 
Mechanical limit of the busbar in the substation itself. Used for short circuit data exchange according to IEC 60909.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Connector_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.4.7. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Connector > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Connector_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.4.8. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Connector > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Connector_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.4.9. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Connector > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor"></a>1.1.5. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./Conductor.json                                                          |

**Description:** Combination of conducting material with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry current between points in the power system.

| Property                                                                   | Pattern | Type   | Deprecated | Definition              | Title/Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ------ | ---------- | ----------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| - [ACLineSegment](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment ) | No      | object | No         | In ./ACLineSegment.json | A wire or combination of wires, with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry alternating current between points in the power system.<br />For symmetrical, transposed three phase lines, it is sufficient to use attributes of the line segment, which describe impedances and admittances for the entire length of the segment.  Additionally impedances can be computed by using length and associated per length impedances.<br />The BaseVoltage at the two ends of ACLineSegments in a Line shall have the same BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage. However, boundary lines may have slightly different BaseVoltage.nominalVoltages and variation is allowed. Larger voltage difference in general requires use of an equivalent branch. |
| - [WireSegment](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment )     | No      | object | No         | In ./WireSegment.json   | A two terminal and power conducting device of negligible impedance and length represented as zero impedance device that can be used to connect auxiliary equipment to its terminals.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment"></a>1.1.5.1. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./ACLineSegment.json                                                      |

**Description:** A wire or combination of wires, with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry alternating current between points in the power system.
For symmetrical, transposed three phase lines, it is sufficient to use attributes of the line segment, which describe impedances and admittances for the entire length of the segment.  Additionally impedances can be computed by using length and associated per length impedances.
The BaseVoltage at the two ends of ACLineSegments in a Line shall have the same BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage. However, boundary lines may have slightly different BaseVoltage.nominalVoltages and variation is allowed. Larger voltage difference in general requires use of an equivalent branch.

| Property                                                                                                                                      | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                                               | Title/Description          |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | -------------------------- |
| - [PowerSystemResource.Location](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_PowerSystemResourceLocation )                         | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | -                          |
| - [PowerSystemResource.GenericAction](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_PowerSystemResourceGenericAction )               | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | -                          |
| - [ConductingEquipment.Terminals](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ConductingEquipmentTerminals )                       | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | Terminal                   |
| - [ACLineSegment.PerLengthImpedance](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentPerLengthImpedance )                 | No      | Combination      | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | -                          |
| - [ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase )                 | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | ACLineSegmentPhase         |
| - [ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ConductingEquipmentBaseVoltage )                   | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | -                          |

| - [ACLineSegment.x](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentx )                                                   | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx )                                                         | x                          |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase_items_ACLineSegmentPhasesequenceNumber"></a>1.1.5.1.5.1.4. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase.sequenceNumber`

**Title:** sequenceNumber

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `integer` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Number designation for this line segment phase. Each line segment phase within a line segment should have a unique sequence number. This is useful for unbalanced modelling to bind the mathematical model (PhaseImpedanceData of PerLengthPhaseImpedance) with the connectivity model (this class) and the physical model (WirePosition) without tight coupling.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.5.1.5.1.5. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.5.1.5.1.6. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.5.1.5.1.7. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.ACLineSegmentPhase > ACLineSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentACLineSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.5.1.5.1.8. | **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.5.1.11. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.5.1.12. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.5.1.13. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_Conductorlength"></a>1.1.5.1.14. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > Conductor.length`

| **Same definition as** | [HydroGeneratingUnit.dropHeight](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_HydroGeneratingUnitdropHeight) |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.5.1.15. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.5.1.16. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_EquipmentinService"></a>1.1.5.1.17. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.5.1.18. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > IdentifiedObject.mRID`
