For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentb0ch"></a>1.1.5.1.19. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.b0ch`

**Title:** b0ch

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [LinearShuntCompensatorPhase.bPerSection](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasebPerSection) |

**Description:** Zero sequence shunt (charging) susceptance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentbch"></a>1.1.5.1.20. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.bch`

**Title:** bch

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [LinearShuntCompensatorPhase.bPerSection](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasebPerSection) |

**Description:** Positive sequence shunt (charging) susceptance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.  This value represents the full charging over the full length of the line.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_ACLineSegment_ACLineSegmentg0ch"></a>1.1.5.1.21. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > ACLineSegment > ACLineSegment.g0ch`

**Title:** g0ch

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **Same definition as** | [LinearShuntCompensatorPhase.gPerSection](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatorShuntCompensatorPhase_items_LinearShuntCompensatorPhasegPerSection) |

**Description:** Zero sequence shunt (charging) conductance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_WireSegmentWireSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.5.2.5.1.4. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > WireSegment.WireSegmentPhase > WireSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_WireSegmentWireSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.5.2.5.1.5. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > WireSegment.WireSegmentPhase > WireSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_WireSegmentWireSegmentPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.5.2.5.1.6. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > WireSegment.WireSegmentPhase > WireSegmentPhase > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.5.2.7. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.5.2.8. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.5.2.9. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_EquipmentinService"></a>1.1.5.2.10. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_Conductorlength"></a>1.1.5.2.11. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > Conductor.length`

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.5.2.14. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Conductor_WireSegment_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.5.2.15. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Conductor > WireSegment > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

#### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator"></a>1.1.6. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./EarthFaultCompensator.json                                              |

**Description:** A conducting equipment used to represent a connection to ground which is typically used to compensate earth faults.   An earth fault compensator device modelled with a single terminal implies a second terminal solidly connected to ground.  If two terminals are modelled, the ground is not assumed and normal connection rules apply.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoilxGroundNominal"></a>1.1.6.8. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > PetersenCoil.xGroundNominal`

**Title:** xGroundNominal

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** The nominal reactance.  This is the operating point (normally over compensation) that is defined based on the resonance point in the healthy network condition.  The impedance is calculated based on nominal voltage divided by position current.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.6.9. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.6.10. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.6.11. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_EarthFaultCompensatorr"></a>1.1.6.12. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > EarthFaultCompensator.r`

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.6.13. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.6.15. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.6.16. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoilmode"></a>1.1.6.19. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > PetersenCoil.mode`

**Title:** mode

|                |                             |
| -------------- | --------------------------- |
| **Type**       | `enum (of string)`          |
| **Required**   | No                          |
| **Defined in** | ./PetersenCoilModeKind.json |

**Description:** The mode of operation of the Petersen coil.

Must be one of:
* "fixed"
* "manual"
* "automaticPositioning"

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoilnominalU"></a>1.1.6.20. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > PetersenCoil.nominalU`

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoiloffsetCurrent"></a>1.1.6.21. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > PetersenCoil.offsetCurrent`

**Title:** offsetCurrent

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** The offset current that the Petersen coil controller is operating from the resonant point.  This is normally a fixed amount for which the controller is configured and could be positive or negative.  Typically 0 to 60 A depending on voltage and resonance conditions.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EarthFaultCompensator_PetersenCoilpositionCurrent"></a>1.1.6.22. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > EarthFaultCompensator > PetersenCoil.positionCurrent`

**Title:** positionCurrent

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** The control current used to control the Petersen coil also known as the position current.  Typically in the range of 20 mA to 200 mA.

#### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Clamp"></a>1.1.7. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./Clamp.json                                                              |

**Description:** A Clamp is a galvanic connection at a line segment where other equipment is connected. A Clamp does not cut the line segment. 
A Clamp is ConductingEquipment and has one Terminal with an associated ConnectivityNode. Any other ConductingEquipment can be connected to the Clamp ConnectivityNode.

| Property                                                                                                      | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                       | Title/Description      |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ---------------------- |
| - [PowerSystemResource.Location](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Clamp_PowerSystemResourceLocation )           | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                | -                      |
| - [PowerSystemResource.GenericAction](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Clamp_PowerSystemResourceGenericAction ) | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                | -                      |
| - [Clamp.ClampAction](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Clamp_ClampClampAction )                                 | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                | -                      |

| - [Clamp.ACLineSegment](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Clamp_ClampACLineSegment )                             | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                | -                      |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Clamp_PowerSystemResourceLocation"></a>1.1.7.1. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > PowerSystemResource.Location`

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Clamp_PowerSystemResourceGenericAction"></a>1.1.7.2. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > PowerSystemResource.GenericAction`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Clamp_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.7.8. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Clamp_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.7.9. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Clamp_ClamplengthFromTerminal1"></a>1.1.7.10. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > Clamp.lengthFromTerminal1`

**Title:** lengthFromTerminal1

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [HydroGeneratingUnit.dropHeight](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_HydroGeneratingUnitdropHeight) |

**Description:** The length to the place where the clamp is located starting from side one of the line segment, i.e. the line segment terminal with sequence number equal to 1.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Clamp_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.7.11. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Clamp_EquipmentinService"></a>1.1.7.12. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Clamp_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.7.13. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Clamp_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.7.14. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Clamp_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.7.15. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Clamp_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.7.16. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Clamp > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

#### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_SeriesCompensator"></a>1.1.8. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./SeriesCompensator.json                                                  |

**Description:** A Series Compensator is a series capacitor or reactor or an AC transmission line without charging susceptance.  It is a two terminal device.

| Property                                                                                                                                    | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                             | Title/Description        |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_SeriesCompensator_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.8.6. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_SeriesCompensator_SeriesCompensatorvaristorPresent"></a>1.1.8.11. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > SeriesCompensator.varistorPresent`

**Title:** varistorPresent

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Describe if a metal oxide varistor (mov) for over voltage protection is configured in parallel with the series compensator. It is used for short circuit calculations.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_SeriesCompensator_SeriesCompensatorvaristorRatedCurrent"></a>1.1.8.12. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > SeriesCompensator.varistorRatedCurrent`

**Title:** varistorRatedCurrent

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **Same definition as** | [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent) |

**Description:** The maximum current the varistor is designed to handle at specified duration. It is used for short circuit calculations and exchanged only if SeriesCompensator.varistorPresent is true.
The attribute shall be a positive value.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_SeriesCompensator_SeriesCompensatorvaristorVoltageThreshold"></a>1.1.8.13. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > SeriesCompensator.varistorVoltageThreshold`

**Title:** varistorVoltageThreshold

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** The dc voltage at which the varistor starts conducting. It is used for short circuit calculations and exchanged only if SeriesCompensator.varistorPresent is true.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_SeriesCompensator_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.8.18. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_SeriesCompensator_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.8.19. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_SeriesCompensator_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.8.20. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > SeriesCompensator > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

#### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Ground"></a>1.1.9. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Ground`

| **Defined in**            | ./Ground.json                                                             |

**Description:** A point where the system is grounded used for connecting conducting equipment to ground. The power system model can have any number of grounds.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Ground_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.9.7. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Ground > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Ground_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.9.8. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Ground > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Ground_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.9.9. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Ground > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Ground_EquipmentinService"></a>1.1.9.10. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Ground > Equipment.inService`

**Title:** inService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

#### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Switch"></a>1.1.10. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./Switch.json                                                             |

**Description:** A generic device designed to close, or open, or both, one or more electric circuits.  All switches are two terminal devices including grounding switches. The ACDCTerminal.connected at the two sides of the switch shall not be considered for assessing switch connectivity, i.e. only Switch.open, .normalOpen and .locked are relevant.

|                      | Array restrictions |
| -------------------- | ------------------ |
| **Min items**        | N/A                |
| **Max items**        | N/A                |
| **Items unicity**    | False              |
| **Additional items** | False              |
| **Tuple validation** | See below          |

| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Switch_SwitchSwitchPhase_items_SwitchPhasenormalOpen"></a>1.1.10.8.1.1. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch > Switch.SwitchPhase > SwitchPhase > SwitchPhase.normalOpen`

| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Used in cases when no Measurement for the status value is present. If the SwitchPhase has a status measurement the Discrete.normalValue is expected to match with this value.

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Switch_SwitchSwitchPhase_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.10.8.1.8. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch > Switch.SwitchPhase > SwitchPhase > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Switch_Equipmentaggregate"></a>1.1.10.15. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch > Equipment.aggregate`

**Title:** aggregate

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail.  In case the flag is set to true the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine.  
The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Switch_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled"></a>1.1.10.16. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch > Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled`

**Title:** networkAnalysisEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis.  If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Switch_EquipmentnormallyInService"></a>1.1.10.17. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch > Equipment.normallyInService`

**Title:** normallyInService

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Switch_CutlengthFromTerminal1"></a>1.1.10.18. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch > Cut.lengthFromTerminal1`

**Title:** lengthFromTerminal1

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [HydroGeneratingUnit.dropHeight](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_RotatingMachine_RotatingMachineGeneratingUnit_oneOf_i0_HydroGeneratingUnitdropHeight) |

**Description:** The length to the place where the cut is located starting from side one of the cut line segment, i.e. the line segment Terminal with sequenceNumber equal to 1.

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Switch_Switchlocked"></a>1.1.10.26. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch > Switch.locked`

**Title:** locked

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** If true, the switch is locked. The resulting switch state is a combination of locked and Switch.open attributes as follows:
<ul>
	<li>locked=true and Switch.open=true. The resulting state is open and locked;</li>
	<li>locked=false and Switch.open=true. The resulting state is open;</li>
	<li>locked=false and Switch.open=false. The resulting state is closed.</li>
</ul>

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_Switch_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.10.27. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > Switch > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

#### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer"></a>1.1.11. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./PowerTransformer.json                                                   |

**Description:** An electrical device consisting of  two or more coupled windings, with or without a magnetic core, for introducing mutual coupling between electric circuits. Transformers can be used to control voltage and phase shift (active power flow).
A power transformer may be composed of separate transformer tanks that need not be identical.
A power transformer can be modelled with or without tanks and is intended for use in both balanced and unbalanced representations.   A power transformer typically has two terminals, but may have one (grounding), three or more terminals.
The inherited association ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage should not be used.  The association from TransformerEnd to BaseVoltage should be used instead.

| Property                                                                                                                                                             | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                             | Title/Description                      |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | -------------------------------------- |
| - [PowerTransformer.TransformerTank](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank )                                               | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                      | TransformerTank                        |
| - [PowerTransformer.PowerTransformerEnd](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerPowerTransformerEnd )                                       | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                      | PowerTransformerEnd                    |
| - [ConductingEquipment.SvStatus](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_ConductingEquipmentSvStatus )                                                       | No      | array            | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                      | SvStatus                               |
| - [PowerSystemResource.AssetDatasheet](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerSystemResourceAssetDatasheet )                                           | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                      | -                                      |
| - [PowerTransformer.beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingCurrent](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerbeforeShCircuitHighestOperatingCurrent ) | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [ExternalNetworkInjection.maxInitialSymShCCurrent](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ExternalNetworkInjection_ExternalNetworkInjectionmaxInitialSymShCCurrent ) | beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingCurrent |
| - [PowerTransformer.beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingVoltage](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerbeforeShCircuitHighestOperatingVoltage ) | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU )                             | beforeShCircuitHighestOperatingVoltage |
| - [PowerTransformer.beforeShortCircuitAnglePf](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerbeforeShortCircuitAnglePf )                           | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [VsConverter.delta](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta )                                                                                                | beforeShortCircuitAnglePf              |
| - [PowerTransformer.highSideMinOperatingU](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerhighSideMinOperatingU )                                   | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU )                             | highSideMinOperatingU                  |
| - [PowerTransformer.isPartOfGeneratorUnit](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerisPartOfGeneratorUnit )                                   | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                      | isPartOfGeneratorUnit                  |
| - [PowerTransformer.operationalValuesConsidered](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformeroperationalValuesConsidered )                       | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                      | operationalValuesConsidered            |
| - [PowerTransformer.vectorGroup](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformervectorGroup )                                                       | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                      | vectorGroup                            |
| - [Equipment.aggregate](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_Equipmentaggregate )                                                                         | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                      | aggregate                              |
| - [Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_EquipmentnetworkAnalysisEnabled )                                               | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                      | networkAnalysisEnabled                 |
| - [Equipment.normallyInService](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_EquipmentnormallyInService )                                                         | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                      | normallyInService                      |
| - [Equipment.inService](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_EquipmentinService )                                                                         | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                      | inService                              |
| - [IdentifiedObject.description](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_IdentifiedObjectdescription )                                                       | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                      | description                            |
| - [IdentifiedObject.aliasName](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_IdentifiedObjectaliasName )                                                           | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                      | aliasName                              |
| - [IdentifiedObject.mRID](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_IdentifiedObjectmRID )                                                                     | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                      | mRID                                   |
| - [IdentifiedObject.name](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_IdentifiedObjectname )                                                                     | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                      | name                                   |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank"></a>1.1.11.1. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank`

**Title:** TransformerTank

|              |         |
| ------------ | ------- |
| **Type**     | `array` |
| **Required** | No      |

**Description:** An assembly of two or more coupled windings that transform electrical power between voltage levels. These windings are bound on a common core and placed in the same tank. Transformer tank can be used to model both single-phase and 3-phase transformers.

|                      | Array restrictions |
| -------------------- | ------------------ |
| **Min items**        | N/A                |
| **Max items**        | N/A                |
| **Items unicity**    | False              |
| **Additional items** | False              |
| **Tuple validation** | See below          |

| Each item of this array must be                                                                               | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [TransformerTank.json](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items) | An assembly of two or more coupled windings that transform electrical power between voltage levels. These windings are bound on a common core and placed in the same tank. Transformer tank can be used to model both single-phase and 3-phase transformers. |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_TransformerTankTransformerTankEnd_items_TransformerEndbmagSat"></a>1.1.11.1.1.1.1.3. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank > TransformerTank > TransformerTank.TransformerTankEnd > TransformerTankEnd > TransformerEnd.bmagSat`

**Title:** bmagSat

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** Core shunt magnetizing susceptance in the saturation region.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_TransformerTankTransformerTankEnd_items_TransformerEndendNumber"></a>1.1.11.1.1.1.1.4. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank > TransformerTank > TransformerTank.TransformerTankEnd > TransformerTankEnd > TransformerEnd.endNumber`

**Title:** endNumber

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `integer` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Number for this transformer end, corresponding to the end's order in the power transformer vector group or phase angle clock number.  Highest voltage winding should be 1.  Each end within a power transformer should have a unique subsequent end number.   Note the transformer end number need not match the terminal sequence number.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_TransformerTankTransformerTankEnd_items_TransformerEndgrounded"></a>1.1.11.1.1.1.1.5. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank > TransformerTank > TransformerTank.TransformerTankEnd > TransformerTankEnd > TransformerEnd.grounded`

**Title:** grounded

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** (for Yn and Zn connections) True if the neutral is solidly grounded.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_TransformerTankTransformerTankEnd_items_TransformerEndmagBaseU"></a>1.1.11.1.1.1.1.6. | **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_TransformerTankTransformerTankEnd_items_TransformerEndrground"></a>1.1.11.1.1.1.1.9. ##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_TransformerTankTransformerTankEnd_items_IdentifiedObjectdescription"></a>1.1.11.1.1.1.1.11. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank > TransformerTank > TransformerTank.TransformerTankEnd > TransformerTankEnd > IdentifiedObject.description`

**Title:** description

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_TransformerTankTransformerTankEnd_items_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>1.1.11.1.1.1.1.12. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank > TransformerTank > TransformerTank.TransformerTankEnd > TransformerTankEnd > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_TransformerTankTransformerTankEnd_items_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>1.1.11.1.1.1.1.13. Property `PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank > TransformerTank > TransformerTank.TransformerTankEnd > TransformerTankEnd > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_TransformerTankTransformerTankEnd_items_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>1.1.11.1.1.1.1.14. **Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

##### <a name="Equipment_ConductingEquipment_PowerTransformer_PowerTransformerTransformerTank_items_ConductingEquipmentSvStatus"></a>1.1.11.1.1.2. ##### <a name="autogenerated_heading_64"></a>1.1.11.1.1.2.1. PowerSystemResource > Equipment > ConductingEquipment > PowerTransformer > PowerTransformer.TransformerTank > TransformerTank > ConductingEquipment.SvStatus > SvStatus.json
