### <a name="TapChanger_PhaseTapChanger"></a>2.2. Property `PowerSystemResource > TapChanger > PhaseTapChanger`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./PhaseTapChanger.json                                                    |

**Description:** A transformer phase shifting tap model that controls the phase angle difference across the power transformer and potentially the active power flow through the power transformer.  This phase tap model may also impact the voltage magnitude.

#### <a name="TapChanger_PhaseTapChanger_TapChangerneutralU"></a>2.2.12. Property `PowerSystemResource > TapChanger > PhaseTapChanger > TapChanger.neutralU`

**Title:** neutralU

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** Voltage at which the winding operates at the neutral tap setting. It is the voltage at the terminal of the PowerTransformerEnd associated with the tap changer when all tap changers on the transformer are at their neutralStep position.  Normally neutralU of the tap changer is the same as ratedU of the PowerTransformerEnd, but it can differ in special cases such as when the tapping mechanism is separate from the winding more common on lower voltage transformers.
This attribute is not relevant for PhaseTapChangerAsymmetrical, PhaseTapChangerSymmetrical and PhaseTapChangerLinear.

#### <a name="TapChanger_PhaseTapChanger_TapChangernormalStep"></a>2.2.13. Property `PowerSystemResource > TapChanger > PhaseTapChanger > TapChanger.normalStep`

**Title:** normalStep

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `integer` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The tap step position used in "normal" network operation for this winding. For a "Fixed" tap changer indicates the current physical tap setting.
The attribute shall be equal to or greater than lowStep and equal to or less than highStep.

#### <a name="TapChanger_PhaseTapChanger_PhaseTapChangerAsymmetricalwindingConnectionAngle"></a>2.2.14. Property `PowerSystemResource > TapChanger > PhaseTapChanger > PhaseTapChangerAsymmetrical.windingConnectionAngle`

**Title:** windingConnectionAngle

|                        |                                                                                                |
| ---------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                             |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                             |
| **Same definition as** | [VsConverter.delta](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta) |

**Description:** The phase angle between the in-phase winding and the out-of -phase winding used for creating phase shift. The out-of-phase winding produces what is known as the difference voltage.  Setting this angle to 90 degrees is not the same as a symmetrical transformer. The attribute can only be multiples of 30 degrees.  The allowed range is -150 degrees to 150 degrees excluding 0.

#### <a name="TapChanger_PhaseTapChanger_TapChangersubsequentDelay"></a>2.2.15. Property `PowerSystemResource > TapChanger > PhaseTapChanger > TapChanger.subsequentDelay`

**Title:** subsequentDelay

|                        |                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [ShuntCompensator.aVRDelay](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_ShuntCompensator_ShuntCompensatoraVRDelay) |

**Description:** For an LTC, the delay for subsequent tap changer operation (second and later step changes).

#### <a name="TapChanger_PhaseTapChanger_TapChangerstep"></a>2.2.16. Property `PowerSystemResource > TapChanger > PhaseTapChanger > TapChanger.step`

**Title:** step

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Tap changer position.
Starting step for a steady state solution. Non integer values are allowed to support continuous tap variables. The reasons for continuous value are to support study cases where no discrete tap changer has yet been designed, a solution where a narrow voltage band forces the tap step to oscillate or to accommodate for a continuous solution as input.
The attribute shall be equal to or greater than lowStep and equal to or less than highStep.

#### <a name="TapChanger_PhaseTapChanger_PhaseTapChangerLinearxMax"></a>2.2.17. Property `PowerSystemResource > TapChanger > PhaseTapChanger > PhaseTapChangerLinear.xMax`

**Title:** xMax

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** The reactance depends on the tap position according to a "u" shaped curve. The maximum reactance (xMax) appears at the low and high tap positions. Depending on the u curve the attribute can be either higher or lower than PowerTransformerEnd.x.

#### <a name="TapChanger_PhaseTapChanger_PhaseTapChangerNonLinearvoltageStepIncrement"></a>2.2.18. Property `PowerSystemResource > TapChanger > PhaseTapChanger > PhaseTapChangerNonLinear.voltageStepIncrement`

**Title:** voltageStepIncrement

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| **Same definition as** | [InefficientBatteryUnit.efficiencyDischarge](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_InefficientBatteryUnitefficiencyDischarge) |

**Description:** The voltage step increment on the out of phase winding (the PowerTransformerEnd where the TapChanger is located) specified in percent of rated voltage of the PowerTransformerEnd. A positive value means a positive voltage variation from the Terminal at the PowerTransformerEnd, where the TapChanger is located, into the transformer.
When the increment is negative, the voltage decreases when the tap step increases.

#### <a name="TapChanger_PhaseTapChanger_PhaseTapChangerNonLinearxMax"></a>2.2.19. Property `PowerSystemResource > TapChanger > PhaseTapChanger > PhaseTapChangerNonLinear.xMax`

**Title:** xMax

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** The reactance depends on the tap position according to a "u" shaped curve. The maximum reactance (xMax) appears at the low and high tap positions. Depending on the u curve the attribute can be either higher or lower than PowerTransformerEnd.x.

#### <a name="TapChanger_PhaseTapChanger_PhaseTapChangerNonLinearxMin"></a>2.2.20. Property `PowerSystemResource > TapChanger > PhaseTapChanger > PhaseTapChangerNonLinear.xMin`

**Title:** xMin

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** The reactance depend on the tap position according to a "u" shaped curve. The minimum reactance (xMin) appear at the mid tap position.   PowerTransformerEnd.x shall be consistent with PhaseTapChangerLinear.xMin and PhaseTapChangerNonLinear.xMin. In case of inconsistency, PowerTransformerEnd.x shall be used.

#### <a name="TapChanger_PhaseTapChanger_PhaseTapChangerLinearxMin"></a>2.2.21. Property `PowerSystemResource > TapChanger > PhaseTapChanger > PhaseTapChangerLinear.xMin`

**Title:** xMin

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx) |

**Description:** The reactance depends on the tap position according to a "u" shaped curve. The minimum reactance (xMin) appears at the mid tap position.  PowerTransformerEnd.x shall be consistent with PhaseTapChangerLinear.xMin and PhaseTapChangerNonLinear.xMin. In case of inconsistency, PowerTransformerEnd.x shall be used.

#### <a name="TapChanger_PhaseTapChanger_TapChangercontrolEnabled"></a>2.2.22. Property `PowerSystemResource > TapChanger > PhaseTapChanger > TapChanger.controlEnabled`

**Title:** controlEnabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** Specifies the regulation status of the equipment.  True is regulating, false is not regulating.

#### <a name="TapChanger_PhaseTapChanger_PhaseTapChangerLinearstepPhaseShiftIncrement"></a>2.2.23. Property `PowerSystemResource > TapChanger > PhaseTapChanger > PhaseTapChangerLinear.stepPhaseShiftIncrement`

**Title:** stepPhaseShiftIncrement

|                        |                                                                                                |
| ---------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                             |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                             |
| **Same definition as** | [VsConverter.delta](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_ACDCConverter_VsConverter_VsConverterdelta) |

**Description:** Phase shift per step position. A positive value indicates a positive angle variation from the Terminal at the  PowerTransformerEnd,  where the TapChanger is located, into the transformer.
The actual phase shift increment might be more accurately computed from the symmetrical or asymmetrical models or a tap step table lookup if those are available.

#### <a name="TapChanger_PhaseTapChanger_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>2.2.24. Property `PowerSystemResource > TapChanger > PhaseTapChanger > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

#### <a name="TapChanger_PhaseTapChanger_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>2.2.25. Property `PowerSystemResource > TapChanger > PhaseTapChanger > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

#### <a name="TapChanger_PhaseTapChanger_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>2.2.26. Property `PowerSystemResource > TapChanger > PhaseTapChanger > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

## <a name="RegulatingControl"></a>3. Property `PowerSystemResource > RegulatingControl`

|                           |                                                                           |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                  |
| **Required**              | No                                                                        |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.") |
| **Defined in**            | ./RegulatingControl.json                                                  |

**Description:** Specifies a set of equipment that works together to control a power system quantity such as voltage or flow. 
Remote bus voltage control is possible by specifying the controlled terminal located at some place remote from the controlling equipment.
The specified terminal shall be associated with the connectivity node of the controlled point.  The most specific subtype of RegulatingControl shall be used in case such equipment participate in the control, e.g. TapChangerControl for tap changers.
For flow control, load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a TopologicalNode (bus) into the conducting equipment.
The attribute minAllowedTargetValue and maxAllowedTargetValue are required in the following cases:
- For a power generating module operated in power factor control mode to specify maximum and minimum power factor values;
- Whenever it is necessary to have an off center target voltage for the tap changer regulator. For instance, due to long cables to off shore wind farms and the need to have a simpler setup at the off shore transformer platform, the voltage is controlled from the land at the connection point for the off shore wind farm. Since there usually is a voltage rise along the cable, there is typical and overvoltage of up 3-4 kV compared to the on shore station. Thus in normal operation the tap changer on the on shore station is operated with a target set point, which is in the lower parts of the dead band.
The attributes minAllowedTargetValue and maxAllowedTargetValue are not related to the attribute targetDeadband and thus they are not treated as an alternative of the targetDeadband. They are needed due to limitations in the local substation controller. The attribute targetDeadband is used to prevent the power flow from move the tap position in circles (hunting) that is to be used regardless of the attributes minAllowedTargetValue and maxAllowedTargetValue.

| Property                                                                                                        | Pattern | Type             | Deprecated | Definition                                                                                                                                                                                              | Title/Description                                                                                                                                      |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ---------------- | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| - [PowerSystemResource.GenericAction](#RegulatingControl_PowerSystemResourceGenericAction )                     | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                       | -                                                                                                                                                      |
| - [RegulatingControl.Terminal](#RegulatingControl_RegulatingControlTerminal )                                   | No      | object           | No         | Same as [Terminal](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items )                                                     | An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes. |
| - [TapChangerControl.limitVoltage](#RegulatingControl_TapChangerControllimitVoltage )                           | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU )                              | limitVoltage                                                                                                                                           |
| - [TapChangerControl.lineDropCompensation](#RegulatingControl_TapChangerControllineDropCompensation )           | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                       | lineDropCompensation                                                                                                                                   |
| - [TapChangerControl.lineDropR](#RegulatingControl_TapChangerControllineDropR )                                 | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.r](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionr )                                        | lineDropR                                                                                                                                              |
| - [TapChangerControl.lineDropX](#RegulatingControl_TapChangerControllineDropX )                                 | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx )                                        | lineDropX                                                                                                                                              |

| - [TapChangerControl.reverseLineDropX](#RegulatingControl_TapChangerControlreverseLineDropX )                   | No      | object or number | No         | Same as [PowerElectronicsConnection.x](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionx )                                        | reverseLineDropX                                                                                                                                       |
| - [IdentifiedObject.description](#RegulatingControl_IdentifiedObjectdescription )                               | No      | string           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                       | description                                                                                                                                            |
| - [RegulatingControl.discrete](#RegulatingControl_RegulatingControldiscrete )                                   | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                       | discrete                                                                                                                                               |
| - [RegulatingControl.mode](#RegulatingControl_RegulatingControlmode )                                           | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [RegulatingControl.mode](#TapChanger_RatioTapChanger_TapChangerTapChangerControl_RegulatingControlmode )                                                                                        | mode                                                                                                                                                   |
| - [RegulatingControl.monitoredPhase](#RegulatingControl_RegulatingControlmonitoredPhase )                       | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [Terminal.phases](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items_Terminalphases )                               | monitoredPhase                                                                                                                                         |
| - [RegulatingControl.targetDeadband](#RegulatingControl_RegulatingControltargetDeadband )                       | No      | number           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                       | targetDeadband                                                                                                                                         |
| - [RegulatingControl.targetValue](#RegulatingControl_RegulatingControltargetValue )                             | No      | number           | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                       | targetValue                                                                                                                                            |
| - [RegulatingControl.targetValueUnitMultiplier](#RegulatingControl_RegulatingControltargetValueUnitMultiplier ) | No      | enum (of string) | No         | Same as [multiplier](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_multiplier ) | targetValueUnitMultiplier                                                                                                                              |
| - [RegulatingControl.enabled](#RegulatingControl_RegulatingControlenabled )                                     | No      | boolean          | No         | -                                                                                                                                                                                                       | enabled                                                                                                                                                |

| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

### <a name="RegulatingControl_RegulatingControlTerminal"></a>3.2. Property `PowerSystemResource > RegulatingControl > RegulatingControl.Terminal`

|                           |                                                                                                                                            |
| ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **Type**                  | `object`                                                                                                                                   |
| **Required**              | No                                                                                                                                         |
| **Additional properties** | [[Any type: allowed]](# "Additional Properties of any type are allowed.")                                                                  |
| **Same definition as**    | [Terminal](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items) |

**Description:** An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. Terminals are connected at physical connection points called connectivity nodes.

### <a name="RegulatingControl_TapChangerControllimitVoltage"></a>3.3. Property `PowerSystemResource > RegulatingControl > TapChangerControl.limitVoltage`

**Title:** limitVoltage

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                   |
| ---------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `object or number`                                                                                                                                                |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Same definition as** | [PowerElectronicsConnection.ratedU](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionratedU) |

**Description:** Maximum allowed regulated voltage on the PT secondary, regardless of line drop compensation. Sometimes referred to as first-house protection.

### <a name="RegulatingControl_TapChangerControllineDropCompensation"></a>3.4. Property `PowerSystemResource > RegulatingControl > TapChangerControl.lineDropCompensation`

**Title:** lineDropCompensation

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** If true, the line drop compensation is to be applied.

### <a name="RegulatingControl_TapChangerControllineDropR"></a>3.5. Property `PowerSystemResource > RegulatingControl > TapChangerControl.lineDropR`

|                        |                                                                                                                                                         |

**Description:** Line drop compensator resistance setting for normal (forward) power flow.

### <a name="RegulatingControl_RegulatingControldiscrete"></a>3.10. Property `PowerSystemResource > RegulatingControl > RegulatingControl.discrete`

**Title:** discrete

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The regulation is performed in a discrete mode. This applies to equipment with discrete controls, e.g. tap changers and shunt compensators.

### <a name="RegulatingControl_RegulatingControlmode"></a>3.11. Property `PowerSystemResource > RegulatingControl > RegulatingControl.mode`

**Title:** mode

|                        |                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `enum (of string)`                                                                                      |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                      |
| **Same definition as** | [RegulatingControl.mode](#TapChanger_RatioTapChanger_TapChangerTapChangerControl_RegulatingControlmode) |

**Description:** The regulating control mode presently available.  This specification allows for determining the kind of regulation without need for obtaining the units from a schedule.

### <a name="RegulatingControl_RegulatingControlmonitoredPhase"></a>3.12. Property `PowerSystemResource > RegulatingControl > RegulatingControl.monitoredPhase`

**Title:** monitoredPhase

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                  |
| ---------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `enum (of string)`                                                                                                                                               |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                               |
| **Same definition as** | [Terminal.phases](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_ConductingEquipmentTerminals_items_Terminalphases) |

**Description:** Phase voltage controlling this regulator, measured at regulator location.

### <a name="RegulatingControl_RegulatingControltargetDeadband"></a>3.13. Property `PowerSystemResource > RegulatingControl > RegulatingControl.targetDeadband`

**Title:** targetDeadband

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** This is a deadband used with discrete control to avoid excessive update of controls like tap changers and shunt compensator banks while regulating.  The units of those appropriate for the mode. The attribute shall be a positive value or zero. If RegulatingControl.discrete is set to "false", the RegulatingControl.targetDeadband is to be ignored.
Note that for instance, if the targetValue is 100 kV and the targetDeadband is 2 kV the range is from 99 to 101 kV.

### <a name="RegulatingControl_RegulatingControltargetValue"></a>3.14. Property `PowerSystemResource > RegulatingControl > RegulatingControl.targetValue`

**Title:** targetValue

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The target value specified for case input.   This value can be used for the target value without the use of schedules. The value has the units appropriate to the mode attribute.

### <a name="RegulatingControl_RegulatingControltargetValueUnitMultiplier"></a>3.15. Property `PowerSystemResource > RegulatingControl > RegulatingControl.targetValueUnitMultiplier`

**Title:** targetValueUnitMultiplier

|                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| ---------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Type**               | `enum (of string)`                                                                                                                                                                             |
| **Required**           | No                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| **Same definition as** | [multiplier](#Equipment_ConductingEquipment_EnergyConnection_RegulatingCondEq_PowerElectronicsConnection_PowerElectronicsConnectionPowerElectronicsUnit_oneOf_i0_BatteryUnitratedE_multiplier) |

**Description:** Specify the multiplier for used for the targetValue.

### <a name="RegulatingControl_RegulatingControlenabled"></a>3.16. Property `PowerSystemResource > RegulatingControl > RegulatingControl.enabled`

**Title:** enabled

|              |           |
| ------------ | --------- |
| **Type**     | `boolean` |
| **Required** | No        |

**Description:** The flag tells if regulation is enabled.

### <a name="RegulatingControl_RegulatingControlmaxAllowedTargetValue"></a>3.17. Property `PowerSystemResource > RegulatingControl > RegulatingControl.maxAllowedTargetValue`

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `number` |

**Description:** Minimum allowed target value (RegulatingControl.targetValue).

### <a name="RegulatingControl_IdentifiedObjectaliasName"></a>3.19. Property `PowerSystemResource > RegulatingControl > IdentifiedObject.aliasName`

**Title:** aliasName

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The aliasName is free text human readable name of the object alternative to IdentifiedObject.name. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.
The attribute aliasName is retained because of backwards compatibility between CIM relases. It is however recommended to replace aliasName with the Name class as aliasName is planned for retirement at a future time.

### <a name="RegulatingControl_IdentifiedObjectmRID"></a>3.20. Property `PowerSystemResource > RegulatingControl > IdentifiedObject.mRID`

**Title:** mRID

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

### <a name="RegulatingControl_IdentifiedObjectname"></a>3.21. Property `PowerSystemResource > RegulatingControl > IdentifiedObject.name`

**Title:** name

|              |          |
| ------------ | -------- |
| **Type**     | `string` |
| **Required** | No       |

**Description:** The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.
